required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multiple Dose Study To Investigate The Effects Of Fesoterodine And Solifenacin On Gastrointestinal Transit
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo Controlled, Parallel Group, Multiple Dose Study To Investigate The Effects Of 8 Mg Fesoterodine SR Tablets And 10 Mg Solifenacin Tablet On Gastrointestinal Transit In Healthy Female Subjects.

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the effect of fesoterodine 8 mg as compared to solifenacin 10 mg on colonic transit.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Protocol A0221057 was terminated on December 25, 2009 for futility. There were no safety concerns related to this decision.

primary_outcome.description: Colonic transit: Geometric centre at 24 hours (GC24) was estimated using geometric mean of counts in ascending (AC), transverse (TC), descending (DC) and rectosigmoid (RS) colon and stool (weighted by factors of 1 to 5 respectively). To calculate the geometric centre, the proportion of colonic counts in each colonic region was multiplied by its weighing factor: (% AC *1 + % TC *2 + % DC *3 + % RS *4 + % stool * 5 ) divided by 100.

secondary_outcome.description: Estimated by power exponential analysis of the proportionate emptying over time of counts from the colon.

Colonic transit: Geometric centre at 48 hours (GC48) was estimated using geometric mean of counts in ascending (AC), transverse (TC), descending (DC) and rectosigmoid (RS) colon and stool (weighted by factors of 1 to 5 respectively). To calculate the geometric centre, the proportion of colonic counts in each colonic region was multiplied by its weighing factor: (% AC *1 + % TC *2 + % DC *3 + % RS *4 + % stool * 5 ) divided by 100.
A surrogate marker of small bowel transit time.
Ascending colon emptying t½ was estimated by power exponential analysis of the proportionate emptying over time of counts from the colon.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Stools Per Day
secondary_outcome.description: Number of stools passed on each notional day where each visit to the toilet counts as one stool (only) unless nothing is passed. Mean of 3 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Score of Stool Consistency Per Day
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated by averaging the values of the stool form given at each visit to the toilet on each notional day. Mean of 3 days. Range of possible scores: 1 (hard lumps) to 7 (watery).

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Score of Ease of Passage During Defecation Per Day
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated by averaging the values given for the ease of passage at each visit to the toilet on each notional day. Mean of 3 days. Range of possible scores: 1 (Manual disimpaction) to 7 (Incontinent).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Proportion of Bowel Movements With Satisfaction Per Day
secondary_outcome.description: The number of stools with satisfaction of "Yes" divided by the total number of stools passed on each notional day. Mean of 3 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy female subjects
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence or history of clinically significant findings at screening

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

outcome.title: Colonic Transit at 24 Hours
outcome.description: Colonic transit: Geometric centre at 24 hours (GC24) was estimated using geometric mean of counts in ascending (AC), transverse (TC), descending (DC) and rectosigmoid (RS) colon and stool (weighted by factors of 1 to 5 respectively). To calculate the geometric centre, the proportion of colonic counts in each colonic region was multiplied by its weighing factor: (% AC *1 + % TC *2 + % DC *3 + % RS *4 + % stool * 5 ) divided by 100.
outcome.population: Intent to treat (ITT) included all randomized subjects. Imputation by overall mean for missing data.

measure.title: Colonic Transit at 24 Hours
measure.description: Colonic transit: Geometric centre at 24 hours (GC24) was estimated using geometric mean of counts in ascending (AC), transverse (TC), descending (DC) and rectosigmoid (RS) colon and stool (weighted by factors of 1 to 5 respectively). To calculate the geometric centre, the proportion of colonic counts in each colonic region was multiplied by its weighing factor: (% AC *1 + % TC *2 + % DC *3 + % RS *4 + % stool * 5 ) divided by 100.
measure.population: Intent to treat (ITT) included all randomized subjects. Imputation by overall mean for missing data.

analysis.groups_desc: Null H10: μF8mg=μS10mg where μF8mg and μS10mg are means of GC24 for fesoterodine 8mg and solifenacin 10mg, respectively.
analysis.estimate_desc: Least squares mean was calculated based on the ANCOVA model with treatment group as a fixed effect and baseline values, age and Body Mass Index (BMI) as covariates.

outcome.title: Proximal Colonic Emptying Time
outcome.description: Estimated by power exponential analysis of the proportionate emptying over time of counts from the colon.
outcome.population: ITT included all randomized subjects. Imputation by overall mean for missing data.

measure.title: Proximal Colonic Emptying Time
measure.description: Estimated by power exponential analysis of the proportionate emptying over time of counts from the colon.
measure.population: ITT included all randomized subjects. Imputation by overall mean for missing data.

outcome.title: Colonic Transit at 48 Hours
outcome.description: Colonic transit: Geometric centre at 48 hours (GC48) was estimated using geometric mean of counts in ascending (AC), transverse (TC), descending (DC) and rectosigmoid (RS) colon and stool (weighted by factors of 1 to 5 respectively). To calculate the geometric centre, the proportion of colonic counts in each colonic region was multiplied by its weighing factor: (% AC *1 + % TC *2 + % DC *3 + % RS *4 + % stool * 5 ) divided by 100.
outcome.population: ITT included all randomized subjects. Imputation by overall mean for missing data.

measure.title: Colonic Transit at 48 Hours
measure.description: Colonic transit: Geometric centre at 48 hours (GC48) was estimated using geometric mean of counts in ascending (AC), transverse (TC), descending (DC) and rectosigmoid (RS) colon and stool (weighted by factors of 1 to 5 respectively). To calculate the geometric centre, the proportion of colonic counts in each colonic region was multiplied by its weighing factor: (% AC *1 + % TC *2 + % DC *3 + % RS *4 + % stool * 5 ) divided by 100.
measure.population: ITT included all randomized subjects. Imputation by overall mean for missing data.

outcome.title: Colonic Filling at 6 Hours
outcome.description: A surrogate marker of small bowel transit time.
outcome.population: ITT included all randomized subjects. Imputation by overall mean for missing data.

measure.title: Colonic Filling at 6 Hours
measure.description: A surrogate marker of small bowel transit time.
measure.population: ITT included all randomized subjects. Imputation by overall mean for missing data.

outcome.title: Time to Gastric Emptying
outcome.description: Ascending colon emptying t½ was estimated by power exponential analysis of the proportionate emptying over time of counts from the colon.
outcome.population: ITT included all randomized subjects. Imputation by overall mean for missing data.

measure.title: Time to Gastric Emptying
measure.description: Ascending colon emptying t½ was estimated by power exponential analysis of the proportionate emptying over time of counts from the colon.
measure.population: ITT included all randomized subjects. Imputation by overall mean for missing data.

outcome.title: Mean Number of Stools Per Day
outcome.description: Number of stools passed on each notional day where each visit to the toilet counts as one stool (only) unless nothing is passed. Mean of 3 days.
outcome.population: ITT, all randomized subjects with analyzeable data. Imputation by individual mean for missing data if at least one observation was observed in last 3 days.

measure.title: Mean Number of Stools Per Day
measure.description: Number of stools passed on each notional day where each visit to the toilet counts as one stool (only) unless nothing is passed. Mean of 3 days.
measure.population: ITT, all randomized subjects with analyzeable data. Imputation by individual mean for missing data if at least one observation was observed in last 3 days.

outcome.title: Mean Score of Stool Consistency Per Day
outcome.description: Calculated by averaging the values of the stool form given at each visit to the toilet on each notional day. Mean of 3 days. Range of possible scores: 1 (hard lumps) to 7 (watery).
outcome.population: ITT, all randomized subjects with analyzeable data. Imputation by individual mean for missing data if at least one observation was observed in last 3 days.

measure.title: Mean Score of Stool Consistency Per Day
measure.description: Calculated by averaging the values of the stool form given at each visit to the toilet on each notional day. Mean of 3 days. Range of possible scores: 1 (hard lumps) to 7 (watery).
measure.population: ITT, all randomized subjects with analyzeable data. Imputation by individual mean for missing data if at least one observation was observed in last 3 days.

outcome.title: Average Score of Ease of Passage During Defecation Per Day
outcome.description: Calculated by averaging the values given for the ease of passage at each visit to the toilet on each notional day. Mean of 3 days. Range of possible scores: 1 (Manual disimpaction) to 7 (Incontinent).
outcome.population: ITT, all randomized subjects with analyzeable data. Imputation by individual mean for missing data if at least one observation was observed in last 3 days.

measure.title: Average Score of Ease of Passage During Defecation Per Day
measure.description: Calculated by averaging the values given for the ease of passage at each visit to the toilet on each notional day. Mean of 3 days. Range of possible scores: 1 (Manual disimpaction) to 7 (Incontinent).
measure.population: ITT, all randomized subjects with analyzeable data. Imputation by individual mean for missing data if at least one observation was observed in last 3 days.

outcome.title: Mean Proportion of Bowel Movements With Satisfaction Per Day
outcome.description: The number of stools with satisfaction of “Yes” divided by the total number of stools passed on each notional day. Mean of 3 days.
outcome.population: ITT, all randomized subjects with analyzeable data. Imputation by individual mean for missing data if at least one observation was observed in last 3 days.

measure.title: Mean Proportion of Bowel Movements With Satisfaction Per Day
measure.description: The number of stools with satisfaction of “Yes” divided by the total number of stools passed on each notional day. Mean of 3 days.
measure.population: ITT, all randomized subjects with analyzeable data. Imputation by individual mean for missing data if at least one observation was observed in last 3 days.

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 7 days after last dose of study drug
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Study was terminated due to futility based on interim analysis with 60 subjects. Although the results of statistical test for the primary endpoint was interpreted, the other endpoint results were interpreted based on statistical inference.
